headline: OVP(DE), high starting salary point, low increasing rate
status:
24 October 2020
"OVP(DE), high starting salary point, low increasing rate"
2.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros:
- The colleagues in low and middle level are friendly
- The comradery level is huge
- The salary starting point is high and generous
cons:
- Salary increasing rate is horrendously low
- Personnel in the manger level are harsh and mean
- VP is caring expenses very much
- Lack of support and resources
- The office is low-tech while working on a project related to IT education in primary schools
- Terrible communication between middle level and management level
advice_to_mgmt:
- Salary incresing rate should be higher
- Be realistic, don't just stay in the ivory tower, look into the real job market
- Be more generous on the expenses and working hour
- Input more on high-tech equipment

headline: don't come here
pros:
nice mix of asian and western academics and culture at the university
cheap (by HK standards) canteen if you like asian food.
cons:
so many.... 
- Feels like a fortress with all the security measures.
- No care by the university towards the students during the protests
- Almost no sporting facilities
- No campus life outside work/study, no cafes/bars/events 
- Terrible weather and very hilly terrain make for so much sweating, some of the buildings are really far from the mtr, why isn't there a shuttle bus??
- Seems really hard to meet and socialise with other staff and students at the university
advice_to_mgmt: listen to what the students want.

headline: Good pay amidst questionable management
status:
20 April 2020
"Good pay amidst questionable management"
3.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: The pay is good when compared to universities in other countries.
cons:
The management focused on traditional journal impact factors, thus developed indicators unfair to new and emerging disciplines. If you are working on an old discipline and published in IF >4 journals you will do well here. But if you aspires to establish yourself in a new area, and published conferences, books, and new journals, you will find little support here.

Also that the management seldom consults its faculties before deploying new policies. Most policies were discussed behind closed door and decreed university wide.
advice_to_mgmt: Promote good researchers from emerging disciplines into the core management team. Look at citation counts across all publications, not just journal IF, in measuring research rigor.

headline: Amazing Workplace
pros: No pressure of work whatsoever the case may be. Excellent place to excel in the academic career. Faculty is very intelligent, innovative and always want to get something innovative out of you.
cons: Even though you perform exceptionally well, you are not allowed to pursue your academic career as faculty after getting your highest degree. You need to go out of the Hong Kong to get some useful experience and then you should come back.
advice_to_mgmt: At least the management needs to increase the salaries of the staff according to the pay scale of the industrial level so as to maintain a good financial balance between the academics and industry.

headline: Limiting
pros:
- boss is good
- colleagues are friendly
- interesting work
- good restaurants
cons:
- no career advancement opportunities 
-no funding of junior research staff for conferences unlike other universities.
- don’t bother applying if you cannot get at least an Assistant Professorship in CityU. Anything below is a waste of time.
- lower salary than HKUST or HKU and even CUHK. 
- miserable annual leave allowance (1 day per month if you are contract staff)
- admin workload is dumped onto research staff. Best ever : they asked for ‘volunteers’ to get free manpower.
- no space. 
- expected to get own funding to publish papers but refuses to let junior staff be a PI - please go to point 1 again
advice_to_mgmt: Fix the cons.

pros: Very energetic. Great young faculties. You can find world-class seminars and conferences here. Also, CityU locates in the middle of a very convenient and international city.
cons: Too young. Short history leads non-guaranteed quality of students. Lack of lab and office space. Sometimes bad management systems in the campus.

headline: Postdoctoral Research Fellow
pros: The university is a fast growing and expanding university with good equipments and facilities.
cons: Paper work and inter-departmental communications reduces efficiency such as procurement speed and reimbursements.

cons: -Hourly standard pay which can be lower than other private tutoring options

headline: Little person development
pros: Good benefits and work-life balance
cons: Little person development, poor working space

headline: Research Fellow (Post-doctoral)
pros: HR staffs are very approachable and friendly. Although there are probably hundreds of contract academic staff in the University, HR staffs are willing to provide useful advice whenever requested by colleagues at all ranks.
cons: The school campus is very small and likewise the University Library. The University should consider giving more spaces to the University Library in future.
advice_to_mgmt: City University of Hong Kong has a very reputation and ranking in the world today. Management of the University should consider to offer more resources to contract research staff from the University central services such as ITS and etc.

headline: Nice place to work
status:

"Nice place to work"
4.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: Awesome coworkers, you can always meet a lot of passionate people on campus
cons: Working with other departments is usually inefficient.
advice_to_mgmt: Allocate more resources to student development eg. entrepreneurship, overseas internship

headline: Graduate Teaching Assistant
pros: Best reasons to work with the College of Business Information Systems Department is that you teach what's been assigned to you and grade assignments and help students out. If you can finish your work then you're basically free to learn new skills and network with academics from other departments
cons: The downsides of working with the College of Business Information Systems Department at the city university of Hong Kong is that the over all climate is the pursuing of excellence through University rankings which is attained through publications in well regarded journals. This leaves academics with very little time other than to keep pushing out more papers, which tend to be trivial at best.
advice_to_mgmt: Advice to the management of the College of Business Information Systems Department, is that there's very little to offer your students compared with computer science which talks about startups, hard core IOT, and analytics. While CS students can do business analytics, IS students can't do analytics, as the programming would be too high a barrier.

headline: Flexible working environment
cons:
- working on weekends sometimes;
- secretarial stuff

headline: Review
pros: Dynamic organisation. Many excellent faculty. Motivated students. Faculty are totally devoted to their mission. Students success is the main objective and everything seems to be done for completing it.
cons: administrative tasks are overwhelming. Passion for forms to fill and acronyms. Pressure for grant chasing and paper publishing against real effective research.

headline: IA
pros: Easy, Detailed, have opportunity to meet up with different people.
cons: Routine, work are well organized, just the instruction.

headline: It depends on who your supervisor is.
status:
14 September 2016
"It depends on who your supervisor is."
4.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros: Colleagues (PhD students, admin staff, other RAs, etc.) are helpful especially if you are new to the job / department. Modern environment but work space could be slightly limited knowing that this is Hong Kong.
cons: Not so much the cons about working at the university, but your experience as a research assistant would largely depend on who your supervisor is. If you meet a nice boss then congratulations! Otherwise, good luck and hang in there. Soak up all the experience and skills while you are there and continue looking for other opportunities and challenges!
advice_to_mgmt: Might be good to consider offering platforms for staff to provide their feedback on their job experience in order to address potential issues such as staff's mental health as academic jobs can become more and more stressful at times and very often a research assistant might feel all alone. Happy staff = generally better job performance!

headline: Research Assistant
pros: Excellent professors, advanced facilities, good compensation
cons: Smaller office, no other cons

headline: Good research platform
pros: It has the world class equipment for scientific research in many areas such as physics, chemistry, materials, biologies, and mechanics, and other engineering fields.
cons: The campus of city university of hong kong is too small. It has very limited ground area for activities.
advice_to_mgmt: I suggest the management department buliding more buildings for students, faculties, and other supports people. There are too many people in small offices.

headline: clerk
pros: no OT, work-life balance, quite good benefit
cons: boring job duties, not many opportunities for career development

headline: Research assistant
pros: have own time to do research
cons: Bad learning curve, too less leading

headline: Shawn
pros: good environment and location, good supervisor
cons: the university ranking is not that high

headline: Research Assistant
pros: The professors and colleagues are all very excellent. It's really a good chance to learn from them. Working schedule is quite flexible, don't have to worry about the working hours; however, be on time is kind of important to my office rules.
cons: The whole environment is quite different from other companies, you don't really feel about a regular schedule when work as a research assistant. Most of us RAs would be happy to study and work together, so that later, they can apply for phd or higher diploma.
advice_to_mgmt: It's good to have some chances to be a RA in CityU, I love my colleagues and boss, who taught me a lot. If people want to continue studying, then being an RA would be a good chance for them to pursue higher education.

headline: research assistant
pros: Great place to work in and learn academically. The student body is diverse, and professors are willing to help students when they are stuck. Being close to a shopping mall is also a big plus.
cons: Work may seem boring and repetitive but is comparable to similar jobs in other institutions. Pay is okay but is slightly lower than most other universities in the area.
advice_to_mgmt: May want to improve enthusiasm amongst mid-tier management. Also should increase student involvement in academic research. Food prices are sometimes expensive.

headline: All depends on your boss
status:
3 May 2016
"All depends on your boss"
2.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: Can be well paid depending on your negotiation skills. The research work can be interesting. The campus is big and convenient. Cheap food.
cons: It's always too much work. Bosses here are heartless and often brainless with limited research imagination. Plan for yourself and do what you believe in as otherwise you will be making their mistakes.
advice_to_mgmt: Change the attitude to research and people. Employ more kind and polite people in administration and treat people decent way.

headline: Working at CityU
status:
12 April 2016
Helpful (1)
"Working at CityU"
3.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: I am an associate professor. Compared to europe, australia, canada etc, the pay is pretty good. But beyond that I am not sure what I can say.
cons:
Many cons:

HR policies are terrible, terrible. especially leave policies. They are so bad that it interferes with the ability to do research. Its such a waste. They pay people a lot but dont allow them to do their research

Student quality is average and below average. English standards are appalling. 

Offices are too small and uncomfortable. If you want high quality research, I can guarantee you one thing - it wont come out of dingy offices!
advice_to_mgmt: Change leave policy. Its so bad that it interferes with the ability to do research internationally. I will be leaving soon, particularly because of this.

headline: Full-time research assistant in CityU
pros: Good working environment and support from faculty. Sometimes field work outside of the office is needed. Flexible working hours (for example, my supervisor allowed me to arrive 30min-60min later in the morning and leave 30-60min later in the evening).
cons: The transportation could be very time consuming if you live in Hong Kong island and travel to work every day. Canteen a little far away from office of research assistants. Additional free courses online are available for research assistants.
advice_to_mgmt: The management is in general quite good except that paperwork across departments can be less or processed quicker. Team building can be strengthened.

headline: Time Wasted and Learn nothing. Poor leader and management.
pros: The salary is okay. The medical benefits are provided and quite comprehensive. The staff can also use the university facilities, such as library, swimming pool, canteen etc. The staff can leave the office sharp as the working hour is regular.
cons:
It is only suitable for people who look for routine and boring job and it is good for wasting your time. The workload is sometimes massive but learn nothing at all.

Some colleagues work very stupid and use the most stubborn way to work on a very simple piece of work. The culture in the company has already been default and no one would try to change it or no one would accept changes. It takes super long time and hierarchy to process a new idea. They are afraid to make mistakes so no one would improve. You must stick to the stupid rules if you want to survive here.

For the management, most of them have worked in this university for over 10 years so they feel like only they have the right to say and do not listen to the subordinates' opinions and just instruct the juniors with their own ideas only. Usually they have nothing to do and just order the juniors to do their work and push all the blames on the junior.

If you still have hope and passion to your life, do not waste a single minute here. It is the worst organization I have ever worked.
advice_to_mgmt: Try to appreciate the work of juniors and provide constructive training to them. Don't waste their talent and life because of your selfishness.
